However, when you buy something through the retail links below, we earn an affiliate commission.What you’ll needChevronChevronMeasuring Cups$18 At Bon Appétit MarketMeasuring Spoons$10 At Bon Appétit MarketMicroplane$16 At AmazonMedium Bowl$17 At AmazonWhisk$10 At AmazonChef's Knife$34.53 At AmazonCutting Board$10 At IKEASmall Bowl$13 At AmazonRimmed Baking Sheet$20 At Bon Appétit MarketLarge Skillet$84 At AmazonTongs$13 At AmazonPlate$55 At Bon Appétit MarketIngredients4  servings2garlic cloves1½cups whole-milk plain Greek yogurt1lemonKosher saltFreshly ground black pepper2teaspoons ground cumin1teaspoon ground coriander¾teaspoon ground turmeric¼teaspoon ground allspice8rib lamb chops (about 1–1¼ inches thick)2tablespoons vegetable oil, dividedPreparationStep 1Peel 2 garlic cloves, then finely grate with a microplane into a medium bowl.Step 2Add 1½ cups yogurt to bowl with garlic. Cut 1 lemon in half crosswise and squeeze 1 half into yogurt mixture with one hand, using your other hand to catch seeds. Season yogurt mixture with salt and pepper and whisk to combine. Transfer ½ cup yogurt mixture to a small bowl; set aside for serving.Play/Pause ButtonPausePlay/Pause ButtonPauseChevronChevronStep 3Whisk 2 tsp. cumin, 1 tsp. coriander, ¾ tsp. turmeric, and ¼ tsp. allspice into remaining yogurt mixture; set aside.Step 4Season both sides of 8 lamb chops with salt and pepper on a rimmed baking sheet or large plate.Step 5Using your hands, evenly coat all meaty surfaces of chops with spiced yogurt mixture. Let chops sit at room temperature 30 minutes, or cover and chill up to 12 hours.Step 6Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Wipe off excess marinade from lamb chops. Working in 2 batches, cook lamb until nicely browned, about 3 minutes per side (the yogurt in the marinade will help them take on color quickly).Step 7Transfer chops to a plate. Pour off fat from skillet (no need to wipe it out). Repeat with remaining 1 Tbsp. oil and chops.Step 8Serve lamb chops with reserved yogurt mixture alongside.Nutrition Per ServingCalories (kcal) 610 Fat (g) 46 Saturated Fat (g) 20 Cholesterol (mg) 165 Carbohydrates (g) 5 Dietary Fiber (g) 1 Total Sugars (g) 3 Protein (g) 44 Sodium (mg) 115 How would you rate Spiced Marinated Lamb Chops with Garlicky Yogurt?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (3)Back to TopTriangleSimple tasty recipeJenNZ1/23/2022This is my go to lamb chop recipe!
